page.title: 18 FARMING
page.content: Over 80% of our area consists of farm land.All the farms are small_just a house and a few outbuildings_and there is only one small settlement which is called{Haywood.Haywood}has a church and a few houses.The farming is a mixture of arable and dairy farming. The chief crops are{wheat}and{barley although we did see some{potatoes. Many fields were planted with grass for grazing or for silage. The cows which were kept were all{Friesians. None of the farms keep sheep but we did see a number of goats grazing by the roadside. Most farms will have their own tractor,plough etc but large machinery such as{combine harvesters would be hired.Although we live in a mechanical age,some farmers are going back to using horses either for economical or environmental reasons.
